channel.title: [C4D] Spoon
channel.description:
[img]http://img99.imageshack.us/img99/508/goodspoonht7.png[/img] [img]http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/3272/spoon3zi6.png[/img] [img]http://img255.imageshack.us/img255/7323/thespoonfp9.png[/img] [img]http://img110.imageshack.us/img110/7076/spoonballzx9.png[/img] [img]http://img518.imageshack.us/img518/5854/spoononmarbledh6.png[/img]
Can anyone help me on getting this to look more realistic, and suggest a floor texture. I really hate floors.

make it a wooden spoon

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:


There we go. And all i did was turn GI off, it usually makes everything bright.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

It’d make a LOT more since to put it on a countertop like that one then, since it issss a kitchen silverware.

Okay. Two things. Make the floor a slightly lower than white material, with a sharper specular and TINYYY bit of reflection, maybe blurred too.

And then make a sphere next to it that’s completely reflective so we can see the HDRI too.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:12, topic:210385”]That’s because you’re supposed to match things like the HDRI and floor up.

What’s the HDRI of?[/quote]
http://www.debevec.org/Probes/

The kitchen probe

Read full topic

ohhh.

Alright i added a floor. Now i totally hate it because when it comes to floors it makes it feel so unreal… I might have stretched it to much…

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yes I meant that.

And it’s alright to learn.
If you’ve experimented with node shading it’ll be easygoing, otherwise it’ll teach you.

It’s not like C4Ds materials.

It’s more like adding nodes of different things, and connecting them in different ways. Really it’s what C4D does down underneath everything

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Spoon is MUCHH better.

Change AA quality to best.

And get a nice floor and you’re cooking with gas.

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yes if you have GI on. They’re very soft however. Good in most situations, but if it’s something with super hard shadows like an outdoor scene you might need another light source.

Here’s the two HDRIs and an alright mahogany wood texture. If you need any kind of wood textures ask me, I’m pretty good with those. It’s tileable too.

http://rapidshare.com/files/119942309/yeah.rar.html

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:2, topic:210385”]Spoons = not on floor lol.

Put it in a sink or something. Put a scratchmap on it. And lower the reflection a lot.

In the second, looks like a light is giving the shadows and not the HDRI.

And if you’re into HDRI, I actually just made two HDRIs around my house today.[/quote]
Im need some good HDRIs, and does the HDRI automatically make shadows? Because i had to add my own light for it.

And floor as in a table top, there are no good wood textures, I want like a black type of wood like on a coffee table

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Spoon
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Spoons = not on floor lol.

Put it in a sink or something. Put a scratchmap on it. And lower the reflection a lot.

In the second, looks like a light is giving the shadows and not the HDRI.

And if you’re into HDRI, I actually just made two HDRIs around my house today.

Read full topic
